etymologies: late 18th century: shortening of line-of-battle ship, originally with reference to the largest wooden warships

definitions: a heavy warship of a type built chiefly in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, with extensive armor and large-caliber guns.
shortDefinitions: heavy warship of type built chiefly in late 19th and early 20th centuries, with extensive armour protection and large-calibre guns
